result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 086257,
Payable Number: 132533,
Receipt Number: 22R 005834,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Victim 1

Defendant ordered to contact Attorney Zacher  today to get information of the victim's name he is to have no contact with.

Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
